intro: Meriania dimorphanthera, commonly known as the red-eyed orchid, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers with red eyespots on the petals. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually elliptical and glossy, contributing to its ornamental appeal. The species is valued in horticulture for its unique floral display and adaptability to certain cultivation conditions.
